verses.verse: (1 He prayeth to be delivered from them that conspire against him, that he might joyfully praise God in his holy congregation.) Judge (He desireth God to undertake his cause against the enemies but chiefly that he would restore him to the Tabernacle.) me, O God, and defend my cause against the unmerciful (That is, the cruel company of mine enemies.) people: deliver me from the deceitful and wicked man.
For thou art the God of my strength: why hast thou put me away? why go I so mourning, when the enemy oppressed me?
Send thy (To wit, thy favor, which appeareth by the performance of thy promises.) light and thy truth: let them lead me: let them bring me unto thine holy Mountain, and to thy Tabernacles.

Then (He promiseth to offer a solemn sacrifice of thanksgiving in token of his great deliverance.) will I go unto the altar of God, even unto the God of my joy and gladness: and upon the harp will I give thanks unto thee, O God my God.

Why art thou cast down, my soul? and why art thou disquieted within me: (Whereby he admonisheth the faithful not to relent, but constantly to wait on the Lord, though their troubles be long and great.) wait on God: for I will yet give him thanks, he is my present help and my God.
